documents.document: @vodafoneNZ Yay, factory reset on modem and we have 4G back. But much lower received power and speeds (up & down) than before.
@vodafoneNZ Nope, rebooted modem but still no service.
@vodafoneNZ Still experiencing a total service outage in Kaitoke - do you have an update ?
@vodafoneNZ No, we've just lost service altogether.
@Wireless_Nation @vodafoneNZ we have been without broadband for two days. Patience starting to wear thin.
@vodafoneNZ At the very least you'd think that by now you'd have a view on when it might, just possibly, get fixed ? 2/
@vodafoneNZ Sorry, your web site claims the site has been under repair for the last 30 hours ? That's not really true is it ? 1/
@vodafoneNZ Hi, still waiting for Kaitoke cell site to be fixed. It's getting frustrating - any news on the replacement part being fitted ?
@vodafoneNZ Thanks for the update - are we talking hours or days ?
@vodafoneNZ any news on when the Kaitoke cell site will be fixed ? We rely on it for RBI.
@northumbriana @steelers Not a city, but Russell (briefly NZ's capital) named after Lord John Russell.
@northumbriana @steelers Wellington, Palmerston North.
M5.2 quake and reading Trump dossier. Neither are good for post lunch digestion.
Teed up the year ahead by spending the morning having teeth descaled. Hopefully it will prove the most uncomfortable hour I spend in 2017.
Sho' got them end of hols blues....
An inspiration to us all https://t.co/vx92rOZwa0
Recovering from two days gardening. More specifically two days of attacking gorse and brambles with a brush cutter.
You really can't beat a wet Sunday morning.
So farewell 2016. A tough year to mark. Personally a solid 7; globally a dismal 2/10.
Uneasy feeling that 2016 is girding its loins in preparation for a truly cataclysmic finale. Zombie apocalypse?
2016 continues on it's dreadful way...
Farewell George Michael. Requiescat in pace.
Proud to be a Kiwi. #IsraeliSettlements https://t.co/GNEcGydkT0
Heading home. One last flight and that's 2016 done. https://t.co/xsutMqpHgv
For the last time in 2016. A view from a hotel room window. https://t.co/AXgqVUleqn
A throwback to a more civilised time: "Good morning John, good morning Sue, and a very good morning to each of you". #TftD
So farewell Rabbi Lionel Blue. A man who could be wise, kind and funny at ten to eight on Monday mornings deserves respect.
Working from home not without its stresses. The hound snaffled @domesticexec's Xmas cookies. Ructions.
And here we go again... #eqnz
I'm guessing John Key has stood down now to find time to concentrate on his batting technique. Much work to do by t… https://t.co/yjBWzEDzlz
You go away for 3 weeks and come back to find the hound has taken over your favourite armchair. https://t.co/CyBTZKfCA4
Back in the land of the long white cloud. https://t.co/n9lVzTr10W
Nagging sense I've forgotten something important. It'll come to me somewhere over the Pacific.
Homeward bound.
Another train journey - tanking through frozen, misty countryside at first light.
Train cancelled. Euphemistically an "incident on the line".
The tube. Rush hour. https://t.co/vOWdFESzbB
View from a hotel room window (an ongoing series). London - cold, crisp, early morning. https://t.co/yIgmXew5Hm
OUI or NON. Politics in the 21st century. https://t.co/ZPy2oxBsdP
Suitably miserable looking buggers - Heroes of the Reformation. https://t.co/SCxilNLKsV
Geneva cathedral, a tad Calvinist for my tastes, but some fine misericords. https://t.co/C4EMwPBIle
Somewhere over there is Mont Blanc. https://t.co/gCLUyBSLKH
Up before dawn, on my way to Geneva.
London - dark and Novemberish.
New morning routine - wake up & check Geonet.
Have been in transit for 34 hours, still an hour away from LHR. Time has become a very abstract concept.
Twitter at 35,000 feet. I'm embracing the future.
Ah, spoke too soon. Waiting hours due to @SingaporeAir intransigence. And now the flight is delayed....
Extended interregnum in Singapore over. Off again.
@SingaporeAir thanks for getting in touch. Have emailed details.
So this'll be the last time I book to fly with @SingaporeAir 2/
Faced with a 7 hour layover. There are empty seats on an earlier flight. But @SingaporeAir want another USD300. 1/
Canberra, late Sunday night, raining.
Right, here we go. Big plane, short runway #holdtight
Back on the road: WLG>CBR>SIN>LHR>LCY>GVA>LHR>SIN>AKL>WLG
Clearly the only people with a handle on what had just happened were the USGS in Colorado. #eqnz
This is sobering - timeline of the shambles that unfolded on Monday morning. Lessons not learnt from Chch. #eqnz https://t.co/MNOsXvpKCs
Recovering from major dental surgery: soft food only; dribbling; bad breath. I guess it's all a foretaste of what's to come.
Confirmation it's been a strange week - finding a good article in the @nzherald https://t.co/gC38r2lzxJ
@justin_lester how many structural engineers are there in Welly ? Exactly how many checks were done in 24 hrs before you reopened the CBD ?
Welly EQ management plan: Mon - a quick check over; Tue - we're open for business; Thurs - oh, hang on... #eqnz
And another one....
It's going to be a sleepless night. After shocks rolling in.
With inordinate excitement have set sky box to record the Mighty Sky Blues v's Scunny.
Still tanking down. So hunkered down on sofa watching Aussie batting being routed. #LifeIsGood.
Clinton tracking to get > 63m votes. Only Obama has ever received more. But losing by 305-233 in EC. Rigged ?
They’re still counting votes in the US of A. Clinton projected to win popular vote by > 2 million.
165mm of rain this week, 100mm since Thursday. Soggy.
All news is local. https://t.co/B0HxyQHE7H
If the police are hanging around waiting to meet a flight it's either a prisoner/suspect or the Prime Minister.
First off the incoming flight is our esteemed PM. Weird how he always gets the first row. What are the chances ?
'Delayed inbound aircraft' is the new 'points failure at Petone'.
Trying to work out if it's safe to go home yet. Fear @domesticexec has taken great umbridge with the US of A.
Though I can see the drawback of travelling in an airless vacuum tube.
Surely this is the future for the Wairarapa Express:Forget high-speed rail, hyperloop will carry commuters at 760mph https://t.co/UjQN1tCl8V
Desperately looking for silver linings. I guess the street value of one of these has gone up by a few bucks ? https://t.co/gwpDXZeYtV
Sat here watching Brexit 2.
Still recovering from a tough weekend. The annual ceremony of The Clearing of the Barn. Skip full of junk; aching muscles.
There's a pot of gold out there somewhere. https://t.co/gWnLUxu1VK
With a grim sense of self satisfaction I'm back to what I do best. Moaning about commuting. Auckland traffic >> KiwiRail.
@WhiteHouseHstry I think you need to check the NZ flag - the stars are *red* with a white border.
When life gives you lemons.... https://t.co/t0jWd4FRz7
Not quite Kyoto but not bad. #cherryblossom https://t.co/kPNPd1wo6W
Roobish ! Call that a forward defence ? https://t.co/bcpS05hvsw
View from the 'office' window. https://t.co/taJGAhqWgi
These boats would be travelling a heck of a lot quicker in Welly . https://t.co/DJ6cnJyo2B
View from a Auckland hotel window. One of an ongoing series. https://t.co/INMDndGsDL
City of Sails. https://t.co/3p8iQXvoub
UK£ hitting new lows against the NZ$. How's that 'hard Brexit' working out ? https://t.co/wczOTlEj5U
Home again. https://t.co/iDWkbpFqtr
About to take off in a thunderstorm. This'll be fun.
In AKL. Arrived in pouring rain. Now stuck in traffic. Eagerly anticipating first conversation about house prices.
The Hutt valley is down there somewhere. https://t.co/Taiw8uIbWE
Back in the land of the Long White Cloud https://t.co/EqKxtHUYsZ
Kapiti Island in the morning sunshine. https://t.co/o4iJoG2qun
Body says 4am, clock says 9pm. Discombobulated.
LAX. Usual scrum to clear security. Only 15 hours from home.
So, has it stopped raining in Welly ?
"You going dahn the end of the line or sumthin?" "Well, yes, you could say"
London cabbie experience: "Where yer goin' mate ?" "Paddington please" "Where you off to ? Goin' far ?" "A long way" Cont'd
